org.ingatan.io
Class ParserWriter

java.lang.Object
  org.ingatan.io.ParserWriter

public abstract class ParserWriter
extends java.lang.Object

This class provides all required utilities to parse files and write them again. One exception to this is that the IOManager reads the groups file itself upon initiation.

This class only provides utilities for parsing/writing text files, and does not deal with zipping or extracting library files, or images (these are dealt with by the IOManager).

Version:
1.0
Author:
Thomas Everingham

writePreferencesFile

public static void writePreferencesFile(java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> characterMap)
Writes the symbol menu character map to file, as this can be edited by the user. The file structure is simply one line per entry, with the first character on that line as the 'key'. So

aäåàáãâæāăą - represents a situation where pressing Ctrl+space and then hitting 'a' will produce a menu with the symbols äåàáãâæāăą. This has now been made the preferences file, as the user can also choose to use Michael to indicate selection in the QuestionList, or a small circle. I couldn't get rid of Michael, but realise that some people might not like him! The first line of this file is now a 1 or 0 corresponding to true or false as to whether or not Michael should be used.

Parameters:
characterMap - the HashMap containing the characters and their corresponding symbol sets.

parsePreferencesFile

public static java.util.HashMap parsePreferencesFile()
Parses the symbol menu configuration into a HashMap. All other preferences will be set directly to the IOManager, or other relevant object.

Returns:
the symbol menu configuration content parsed into a HashMap.
